content:
Create a Capacity Plan

To create a short-term or long-term capacity plan, you need to set up prerequisites and use an intelligent forecast. A forecast generated from a workload history is required, along with at least one job profile and active shift templates associated with each job profile.

Shift templates must start and end on the quarter hour and fully cover and align with the exact operating hours listed on the service territory associated with the plan. Before creating a plan, make sure your admin follows the checklist to set up capacity planning.

To add a capacity plan from a forecast:

From the App Launcher, open Intelligent Forecasts.
Open the forecast that you want to create your plan from.
Click Add Capacity Plan.

To add a capacity plan directly from the App Launcher:

Open Capacity Plans.
Click New.
Select the forecast that you want to create the plan from.
Select the type of capacity plan that you want to create.

Specify the plan's start date and duration, then select one or more job profiles. For each job profile, set up mappings for channels, skills, custom fields, shrinkage, and shift duration.

Map combinations of channel, skill, and custom fields to each job profile, and set the Shrinkage and Shift Duration. Repeat these steps for each job profile.

For each job profile, define work units and channel characteristics, prioritize channels, and specify goals for service level agreements (SLAs) and defaults for each channel's average handle time (AHT).

Name your plan, and save your changes. When the plan is calculated, the status changes to Shift Calculation Completed. The dashboard shows how many shifts or FTEs are predicted to meet demand during the time interval.

Required Editions and User Permissions
Workforce Engagement is available in Lightning Experience.
Available in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions.
Requires Admin permission to create a capacity plan.
title: Creating a Service Cloud Capacity Plan
